In 1991 Jordan Pine was a dentist studying for his law degree. Now he is a lawyer who has developed a board game, Proverbial Wisdom, in which players draw sketches to illustrate famous sayings while others try to guess the sayings.
He admits it's a strange occupational twist, but if he was able to combine two careers (he specializes in dental malpractice), why not a third?

Mr. Pine, who lives in Valley Cottage, came up with the idea while walking in a snowstorm in 1994. He grabbed a napkin and made a sketch of a body with two heads, asking a friend to identify the proverb it represented. The friend correctly guessed, ''Two heads are better than one.''
Five years later his board game went on the market, and the first printing of 10,000 copies sold out, mostly through catalogs and specialty stores.
The game, a combination of Trivial Pursuit and Pictionary, sells for $29.95.
